instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.ISL9239: What is ISL9239? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2016-2018 responsible for charging the battery and creating the power rail PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.C6905: What is C6905? Capacitor to ground on charger input, if this shorts to ground the charger will not put out any power. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Board here. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 2.60V, no short to ground.
I have replaced one of the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips (it had a hole in it)
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is 5.1V. Charger is stuck at 5.1V, 0.24A
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> is 4.602V
I have also replaced diode <DIODE>D6902</DIODE> with no change

Should I be replacing <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP>? What are my next steps?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Any history available?

Post diode mode (red probe at ground) at <RESISTOR>R6915</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR>.
Also post <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> volages; pins 2, 10, 1, 3, 9.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Customer said MacBook would not turn on. I verified this by connecting charger and Mac was only accepting 5.1V at 0.24A on three of the four ports. The last port was doing nothing at all. I removed board and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> was only 2.6V and UB300 had a small hole through it. I removed and replaced this chip and repaired one of the broken traces for <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> connected to this <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip. Here are the requested readings after this work was done:

Diode:
<RESISTOR>R6915</RESISTOR> = 0.370V
<CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> = 0.578V

<CHIP>U6905</CHIP> Voltages:
Pin 2= 4.60V
Pin 10 = 4.986V
Pin 1 = 7.30V
Pin 3 = 2.80V
Pin 9 = 0.772V

Thanks in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6903</CHIP> swapped out. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is now 1.7V, Charger is still at 5.1V, but now drawing 0 Amps. Here are the same measurements:

Diode:
<RESISTOR>R6915</RESISTOR> = 0.362V
<CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> = 0.572V

<CHIP>U6903</CHIP> Voltages:
Pin2 = 5.02
Pin10 = 4.99
Pin1 = 6.52
Pin 3 =1.80
Pin 9 = 0.46

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0.24V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Remove <CAPACITOR>C6911</CAPACITOR> and try again.
Check all <RESISTOR>R6910</RESISTOR>-13 resistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R6910</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R6911</RESISTOR> are both bad. Where do I find these resistors? Digikey and Mouser only have available in 10,000 quantity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 Low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
5-10% tollerance resistors are accepted.
Aliexpress is the best place to get SMD resistor kits.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.aliexpress.com/wholesale?catId=0&initiative_id=SB_20210112131832&SearchText=smd+resistor+book[/URL]
Do NOT buy resistors + caps books.
You will need 0201, 0402, 0603 and 0805 size models.
1206 rarely used, maybe if work on TVs...
